info.name: Octobattles API
info.description:
Octobattles is a game that allows programmers to fight each other using their pet octopus and the programming languages available on public GitHub repositories.

The API allows creation of new characters, assignment of languages, and simulation of new battles.

item.name: Characters
item.description:
Character information and addition.

Characters are the programmer's pet, identified with its owner name on github, can fight for him using the most used programming languages as habilities.

Each character can gain experience points and has a persistent life gauge.

item.name: Battles
item.description:
This endpoint allows to get meta information about all battles, for a specific character or between specific oponents.
It also allows to trigger battles between two oponents.

request.description: List all the latest battles made between all octopus

response.name: Usage

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Header
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Access-Control-Expose-Headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: Access-Control-Expose_headers
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Access-Control-Max-Age
header.description: Indicates how long the results of a preflight request can be cached in seconds.

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Keep-Alive
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: X-Authorization
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Powered-By
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Access-Control-Expose-Headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

request.description:
Initiate a battle between two characters. Each character will attack in turns using his habilities (Languages).
Both characters must exist, be alive and have at least one available language to attack.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Header
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Access-Control-Expose-Headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: Access-Control-Expose_headers
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Access-Control-Max-Age
header.description: Indicates how long the results of a preflight request can be cached in seconds.

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Keep-Alive
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: X-Authorization
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Powered-By
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)
